definition[0]: when something is changed and organized in a different way
example[0]: a realignment of the companyâ€™s management structure
definition[1]: when people stop supporting one group and start to support and work together with a different group
example[1]: There is now a need for a realignment of political parties.
definition[2]: when the parts of something are arranged so that they return to their correct positions in relation to each other
example[2]: the realignment of several major roads
definition[3]: a change in the exchange rate between currencies
definition[4]: a change in the way that a company is organized
example[4]: The corporate realignment involved moving senior managers to the company headquarters in Santa Monica.
